content:
hello all,
dose any fhir server supports $document operation?
and process the documents?
what is the endpoint(post/put: url) i need to specify while submitting the document to a server?
I would think Grahame's (healthintersection) does - and HAPI might (@James Agnew ). What about Vonk? (@Christiaan Knaap )?
Vonk does not yet support $document.

getting the below error while testing on fhirtest.uhn.ca server(@James Agnew 's server)

issue": [
{
"severity": "error",
"code": "processing",
"diagnostics": "Invalid request: The FHIR endpoint on this server does not know how to handle GET operation[Composition/$document] with parameters [[]]"
}
Did you try invoking it with POST?
yes
getting the same problem.

@Lloyd McKenzie ,
If I wish to store a document on fhir server ,to which end point I need to send ? Bundle or Composition?
Bundle.
how come we know whether server processing as document? or simpley accepting it as a bundle?
do we need to create DocumentReference for every Document separately? or server will create it based on the content available on Composition resource/document?

on Grahame 's server getting different issue.
POST http://test.fhir.org/r3/Composition/$document
body: bundle
issue:
severity": "error",
"code": "not-found",
"diagnostics": "Resource Id "Composition/" does not exist"
Servers don't "process" documents generally. They just store them - which is what POSTing to Bundle would do.
Can you please submit a change request? I don't think it's legal to invoke Composition/$document. You always have to specify the id of the composition you want to generate a document based on.
(And, at least at present, there's no ability to specify the composition as an input parameter)

There are two options:
1. serverbase/Composition/$document and 2. Serverbase/Composition/id/$document
what is the main purpose of $document operation?

$document generates a document based on the specified Composition (which defines the table of contents). I know that serverbase/Composition/$document is listed as an option, but I believe that's an error.
yes I think it's an error
GF#13987
Added to the SDWG agenda for Thursday.

getting the below error while testing $document operation
GET http://test.fhir.org/r3/Composition/10/$document
error status : 404
Cannot resolve external reference: http://test.fhir.org/r3/Patient/228821
